name: Chest
description: Includes the pectoral muscles, responsible for pushing motions such as pressing or pushing exercises.

name: Back
description: Primarily consists of the latissimus dorsi, trapezius, and rhomboids, essential for pulling and rowing movements.

name: Shoulders
description: Composed of the deltoid muscles, responsible for raising and rotating the arms in various directions.

name: Biceps
description: Located on the front of the upper arm, these muscles are used in curling and pulling motions.

name: Triceps
description: Located on the back of the upper arm, these muscles are involved in straightening the arm during pushing exercises.

name: Core
description: Comprises the abdominal and oblique muscles, essential for stability, balance, and rotational movements.

name: Quadriceps
description: Located on the front of the thigh, these muscles are responsible for extending the knee and powering leg movements.

name: Hamstrings
description: Located on the back of the thigh, these muscles are involved in bending the knee and extending the hip.

name: Glutes
description: Composed of the gluteus maximus, medius, and minimus, these muscles provide power for hip extension and stability.

name: Calves
description: Located on the lower leg, these muscles are responsible for ankle extension and supporting walking or running movements.

name: Forearms
description: These muscles control wrist movements and gripping strength, important for pulling and lifting exercises.

name: Traps
description: The trapezius muscles extend along the upper back and neck, crucial for shoulder shrugging and upper-body stability.

name: Lower Back
description: The muscles along the lower spine, crucial for spinal stability, posture, and hip movement.
